column2: Do you want to submit a tool or a resource?
column3: Name
column22: Case study
column23: Short description

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Strenghtening Integrated Flood Risk Management - Managing uncertainty in Integrated Flood Risk Management using Dynamic Adaptive Pathways Planning
column22: yes, it provides some shot examples from a case study.
column23: This technical guidance introduces the use of Dynamic Adaptive Pathways Planning as an approach for dealing with (deep) uncertainties in integrated flood risk management, and is intended for use by ADB officers and Developing member countries partners.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Adaptation pathways for infrastructure operators and policymakers
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: This briefing introduces adaptation pathways for infrastructure resilience under uncertain future climate conditions. It includes a framework with nine steps for developing pathways (e.g., defining scope, identifying hazards, generating options, and evaluating pathways). Case studies from the Thames Estuary, Dutch Delta Programme, and others illustrate the method, alongside stakeholder feedback and benefits. The approach combines Quinn et al.'s (2018) Rail Adapt framework with practical applications for UK infrastructure planning.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Adaptation pathways: A playbook for developing robust options for climate change adaptation in Natural Resource Management
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: A playbook guiding users through climate change adaptation pathways. It outlines five key activities ('plays') for planning and adaptation, with brief descriptions and references to additional resources for detailed guidance.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Southern Slopes Information Portal Report - Climate change adaptation information for natural resource planning and implementation
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: Two complementary reports: a playbook on adaptation pathways detailing five activities and a technical report exploring these steps in depth. The latter includes links to resources and literature, enhancing understanding of climate change adaptation planning.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: A user's guide to applied adaptation pathways - Adaptation into action
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: A non-technical guide to developing and applying adaptation pathways in organizations, emphasizing critical elements for participatory planning. The process is adaptable for quantitative inputs but focuses on user-friendly methods.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Sea Level Rise Guidance state of California
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: This report integrates the best available science on sea level rise and coastal hazards. It provides practical guidance for planning under different scenarios, including adaptation pathways for Californiaâ€™s coastal management.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: User guide for the climate change adaptation pathways framework - Supporting sustainable local food in BC; Climate Change adaptation pathways framework - Supporting Sustainable Local food in BC
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: Two reports provide guidance for agricultural communities on shared adaptation goals and pathways. A technical guide complements this with a detailed application of adaptation in food production, including a hypothetical case study.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Climate Risk Informed Decision Analysis (CRIDA) - Collaborative water resources planning for an uncertain future
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: A decision-making framework for climate risk-informed analysis (CRIDA), targeting water resource managers and infrastructure planners. It supports robust planning under uncertainty for flood risk and water supply management.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Guide to dynamic planning of climate adaptation and management of the risk of flooding in municipalities
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: A concise guide to dynamic planning for climate adaptation and flood risk management. It aims to help municipalities in Denmark adopt adaptive, risk-based approaches to planning and mitigation.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Coastal hazards & climate change guidance
column22: yes, it provides some shot examples from a case study.
column23: New Zealand's Ministry developed this guidance for adapting to coastal hazards under climate change. It follows a 10-step decision cycle, integrating short- and long-term planning for adaptive pathways and coastal risk management.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Procedures to evaluate sea-level change
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: An engineering pamphlet offering procedural guidance for analyzing future sea level change (SLC) impacts on USACE projects. It focuses on assessing physical and ecological risks, but not as formal planning guidance.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: The NRM Adaptation Checklist
column22: yes, it provides some shot examples from a case study.
column23: A technical guide for Australian natural resource managers on adaptation planning. It addresses challenges intensified by climate change and outlines a flexible planning framework to remain effective under changing conditions.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: WRMP 2019 Methods - Decision Making Process: Guidance
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: Guidance for decision-making in water resource management, focusing on investment appraisal and optimization for long-term planning. The framework emphasizes sustainability and robustness in resource allocation.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Pathways2Reslience Technical Guidance
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: Pathways2Resilience project guidance outlines a step-by-step Regional Resilience Journey framework. It includes climate strategy, action, and finance plans, tailored for project managers and technical experts. Scenarios are addressed briefly.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: CLIMAAX CRA Handbook
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: A handbook on quantifying climate risks for hazards like floods, droughts, and heatwaves. It includes tools for customizing and uploading CRAs (climate risk assessments), fostering iterative learning with future scenario exploration.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Guidance for Uncertainty Assessment and Communication
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: Guidance on managing and communicating uncertainty in assessments. It supports analysts in addressing critical uncertainties, framing problems, and involving stakeholders, leading to better decision-making under uncertainty.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Towards a Climate-Resilient Future Together: Tools for Engaging Citizens for a Better Future
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: A step-by-step guide on engaging citizens in foresight exercises to build climate-resilient futures. It includes methods like exploratory scenarios, pathways, and case studies from multiple European countries.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Protocol for Designing Incremental Scenarios
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: This approach integrates incremental, participatory scenario planning with local communities to develop desirable futures. It inventories 'hinge points' for critical challenges and uses real-world case studies to refine methods.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Decision-making in our Uncertain World: Which, When and How
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: A guide for planning under uncertainty, offering methods for decision-making in sectors like land-use, infrastructure, and coastal adaptation. It distinguishes between creation and analysis approaches, with examples from various fields.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: RAMSETE III – Uncertainty – from Science to Policy
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: The serious game 'RAMSETE III' simulates crisis management decision-making under uncertainty. Players collaborate to handle evacuation timing during a storm, learning effective communication and strategic planning in critical situations.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: WeShareIt Game: Strategic foresight for climate-change induced disaster risk reduction
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: WeShareIt' is a collaborative board game for policymakers to balance energy, food, and nature needs at basin and national levels. Players explore strategies to strengthen collaboration and prepare for future uncertainties.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Sustainable Delta Game
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: Sustainable Delta' is a serious game for stakeholders to understand water systems and plan restoration measures. Teams develop a water management plan addressing challenges like flooding and drought in fictional river settings.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Water Programming: A Collaborative Research Blog
column22: no, it does not contain any information from a case study.
column23: A blog by Pat Reed's team at Cornell focusing on computational approaches like Multiobjective Evolutionary Algorithms, simulation models, and visualization for solving complex planning problems.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: A DMDU Guidebook for Transportation Planning Under a Changing Climate
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: A guide for incorporating Decision Making Under Deep Uncertainty (DMDU) into transportation planning. It reviews methods like scenario planning and Adaptive Pathways, with steps for applying these techniques to IDB projects.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Addressing Uncertainty in MultiSector Dynamics Research
column23: This guidance text has been developed in support of the Integrated Multisector Multiscale Modeling (IM3) Science Focus Area’s objective to formally integrate uncertainty into its research tasks. The guidance offers a deep-dive into methods to be used for sensitivity analysis and exploration of uncertainty. Along the introduction of the underlying concepts, the resource offers tutorials for the application.

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Decision Making under Deep Uncertainty - From Theory to Practice
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: This can be seen as the general introduction to DMDU. It offers insights into the underlying concepts and provides examples for all relevant cases

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Taxonomy of purposes, methods, and recommendations for vulnerability analysis
column23: This scientific resource reviews existing vulnerability analysis approaches in the context of DMDU to offer a taxonomy and different use purposes

column2: I want to submit a resource
column3: Confronting Climate Uncertainty in Water Resources Planning and Project Design: The Decision Tree Framework
column22: yes, it provides an extensive illustration of a case study.
column23: This guidance was developed to introduce a climate stress-testing methodology for water resource managenet infrastrucutre. It offers insights in the funcamental concepts, the how-to guidance and a specific case for illustration. Furthermore high-level information are provided regarding other DMDU methologies.
